extendedIngredients.name: chili sauce
extendedIngredients.original: 1/2 teaspoon Asian red chili sauce, such as Sriracha

extendedIngredients.name: fresh mint leaves
extendedIngredients.original: 1/3 cup loosely packed fresh mint leaves, sliced into thin slivers
extendedIngredients.originalName: loosely packed fresh mint leaves, sliced into thin slivers

extendedIngredients.name: lemon grass
extendedIngredients.original: 2 tablespoons finely chopped fresh lemon grass

extendedIngredients.name: shrimp

extendedIngredients.originalName: shrimp, peeled (leave tails intact) and deveined

extendedIngredients.name: wooden skewers
extendedIngredients.original: 6 wooden skewers (6 in. each), soaked in water

title: Peppery Grilled Shrimp (Tom Nuong Toi Xa Ot)
summary: You can never have too many main course recipes, so give Peppery Grilled Shrimp (Tom Nuong Toi Xan Ot) a try. Watching your figure? This gluten free, dairy free, and pescatarian recipe has 243 calories, 25g of protein, and 12g of fat per serving. This recipe serves 4 and costs $3.42 per serving. This recipe from My Recipes has 1 fans. The Fourth Of July will be even more special with this recipe. If you have mint leaves, asian chili sauce, lemon grass, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. To use up the sugar you could follow this main course with the Whole Wheat Refined Sugar Free Sugar Cookies as a dessert. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes around 40 minutes. With a spoonacular score of 48%, this dish is good. Try Lemongrass Shrimp over Rice Vermicelli and Vegetables (Bun Tom Nuong Xa), Grilled Beef with Lemon Grass and Garlic (Bo Nuong Xa Toi), and Vietnamese Grilled Chicken with Vermicelli Noodles (Bun Ga Nuong) for similar recipes.

winePairing.pairingText: Shrimp on the menu? Try pairing with Pinot Grigio, Riesling, and Sauvignon Blanc. These crisp white wines work well with shrimp prepared in a variety of ways, whether grilled, fried, or in garlic sauce. One wine you could try is Ziobaffan Organic Pinot Grigio. It has 4.6 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 17 dollars.

productMatches.title: Ziobaffa Organic Pinot Grigio
productMatches.description: Ziobaffa Organic Pinot Grigio has fresh rich aromas of apples and pears with hints of citrus that fade into a floral bouquet and on the palate it is bright and fresh with wonderful fruit flavors.ZIOBAFFA Pinot Grigio pairs well with a wide array of lighter cuisine, especially fish/shellfish, poultry, pastas in cream sauce and softer cheeses. It's also an ideal aperitif. Blend: 100% Pinot Grigio

instructions: In a medium bowl, whisk together lemon grass, garlic, chili sauce, fish sauce, sugar, olive oil, lime juice, pepper, and green onions. Add shrimp and toss to coat. Let marinate 15 minutes at room temperature or up to 1 hour in the refrigerator.                                                                                                 Prepare a gas or charcoal grill for high heat (you can hold your hand 1 to 2 in. above grill level only 2 to 3 seconds). Brush grill with vegetable oil. Thread shrimp onto skewers and grill until curled, pink, and opaque, 2 to 3 minutes per side. Remove skewers and garnish with mint.                                                                                                Note: Nutritional analysis is per serving.

steps.step: In a medium bowl, whisk together lemon grass, garlic, chili sauce, fish sauce, sugar, olive oil, lime juice, pepper, and green onions.
Add shrimp and toss to coat.
Let marinate 15 minutes at room temperature or up to 1 hour in the refrigerator.
Prepare a gas or charcoal grill for high heat (you can hold your hand 1 to 2 in. above grill level only 2 to 3 seconds).
Brush grill with vegetable oil. Thread shrimp onto skewers and grill until curled, pink, and opaque, 2 to 3 minutes per side.
Remove skewers and garnish with mint.
